page.title: 10CONCLUSION,SOUTH FEN/TWENTY
page.content: In this small{area of South Lincoln {shire}which is almost exclusively down to{farmland,}it is very difficilt to define any given amenities or items of special interest. However,life on the {fenlands}is{typical of the area;}only the scrapyard seems out of character. The{study}of the area has been {undertaken by}the children in{Class 4L at{Bourne County Primary School}with their class teacher, Mr.J.H.Lambert and the headmaster, Mr.R.N.Wright. The following children have taken a special interest; Emma Johns, Andrew Pateman, Karen Dawson, Rachel Anning, James Hart and Christopher Warwick. Much of the background information came from Emma's uncle who lives in Tongue End. Our{thanks}are due to the haulage, foundry/scrapyard{owners and farmers } for their help and co-operation.
